tag_list: entrepreneur, media-relations, public-relations, media, host, radio, marketing, strategy, law
overview:
Jason Grill is the Owner of JGrill Media, LLC, where he focuses on media relations, communications, public/civic affairs and government relations. Jason is a strategic relationship builder who is very passionate about connecting individuals and businesses to get the right exposure and resources. He also works as a local, state and national contributor, commentator and analyst. Jason writes for the Huffington Post, Politico, KC Business Magazine and the Recovering Politician. He is a television political analyst for Fox 4 WDAF, a regular contributor to Wall Street Journal Radio and host of the Entrepreneur KC Radio Show on the KMBZ Business Channel.

In addition, Jason is a practicing attorney in Missouri and Kansas. He is a former two-term member of the Missouri House of Representatives, where he passed historic legislation to help families of children with autism. (Video)

Jason has worked as an adjunct professor at Park University. He also has worked in the White House with a senior advisor to Vice President Al Gore and an advisor to President Bill Clinton, Alvin Brown (Currently Mayor of Jacksonville, Florida), as well as at the CNN with senior political correspondent, Brooks Jackson (Director of factcheck.org).
